org.lcsim.detector.tracker.silicon

Class HpsSiSensor

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.lcsim.detector.DetectorElement
      • org.lcsim.detector.tracker.silicon.SiSensor
        • org.lcsim.detector.tracker.silicon.HpsSiSensor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Identifiable, IDetectorElement
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    HpsTestRunSiSensor, HpsThinSiSensor

    public class HpsSiSensor
extends SiSensor
    This class extends SiSensor with conditions specific to HPS SVT half-modules (sensors) used during the engineering run and beyond. Each half-module is uniquely identified by a FEB ID/Hybrid ID pair which is then related to calibration conditions such as baseline, noise, gain etc.

      • isTopLayer

        public boolean isTopLayer()
        Get whether this sensor is in the top half of the detector. Modules in the top half have module numbers of 0 or 2.
        Returns:
        True if sensor is in top layer; false if not.

      • isBottomLayer

        public boolean isBottomLayer()
        Get whether this sensor is in the bottom half of the detector. Modules in the bottom half have module numbers of 1 or 3.
        Returns:
        True if sensor is in bottom layer; false if not.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Reset the time dependent conditions data of this sensor. This does NOT reset the sensor setup information, which is assumed to be fixed once it is setup for a given session.

      • getStripLength

        protected double getStripLength()
        Return the length of an HpsSiSensor strip. This is done by getting the face of the HpsSiSensor and returning the length of the longest edge.
        Returns:
        The length of the longest HpsSiSensor edge
